                             == libFuzzer crashing input ==                                                                                                                     
                             ===Evaluation Report===                                                                                                                            
                             # Evaluation Report                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                                                
                             ## Summary                                                                                                                                         
                             An out-of-memory condition was detected by Jazzer when fuzzing PDF text extraction in Apache PDFBox. The OOM occurs in                             
                             `org.apache.fontbox.pfb.PfbParser.parsePfb`, which eagerly buffers entire PFB font streams into memory. A patch was attempted to                   
                             refactor `PfbParser` to stream data in chunks up to a defined limit (`MAX_PFB_STREAM_LENGTH`), introduce new constructors, and                     
                             update `PDType1Font` to use a limited read utility. After applying the patch, the FontBox module fails to compile with dozens of                   
                             illegal start of type and identifier expected errors in `PfbParser.java`, indicating syntax problems (unclosed comments,                       
                             duplicate method signatures, misplaced braces).                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                
                             ## Description                                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                
                             Initial issue                                                                                                                                      
                             - Jazzer reported a low-severity security finding:                                                                                                 
                               com.code_intelligence.jazzer.api.FuzzerSecurityIssueLow: Out of memory (use '-Xmx1710m' to reproduce)                                            
                             - Stack trace pinpoints an OOM in `PfbParser.parsePfb(byte[])` while reading a large PFB font into a single byte array.                            
                                                                                                                                                                                
                             Important observations                                                                                                                             
                             - The parser reads the entire PFB file into memory upfront (`in.readAllBytes()` or `Files.readAllBytes`) before segmenting it.                     
                             - Very large or maliciously crafted PFB streams exhaust the Java heap.                                                                             
                             - The issue arises in FontBoxs PFB processing and surfaces downstream in PDFBoxs text-stripping code.                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                
                             Patch attempt                                                                                                                                      
                             - Introduced a constant `MAX_PFB_STREAM_LENGTH = 50_000_000` to cap total bytes read.                                                              
                             - Removed `readAllBytes` usage and replaced it with a new `parsePfbStream(InputStream)` method that:                                               
                                Wraps the input in `DataInputStream`                                                                                                           
                                Reads markers, type bytes, little-endian segment sizes                                                                                         
                                Enforces the cumulative size limit before allocating each segment buffer                                                                       
                                Streams each segment in a loop rather than all at once                                                                                         
                                Assigns `segment1` and `segment2` fields from the lists of byte arrays                                                                         
                             - Added streaming constructors for `(String filename)`, `(InputStream)`, and `(byte[])`.                                                           
                             - Updated `PDType1Font` to call `PfbParser.toByteArrayLimited` (with the same length cap) instead of `toByteArray()` on the entire                 
                             font stream.                                                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                                
                             Compilation result                                                                                                                                 
                             - Maven reports 45 errors in `PfbParser.java`, all illegal start of type, <identifier> expected, or class, interface, or enum                 
                             expected.                                                                                                                                         
                             - Errors occur around the new constructors and `parsePfbStream` method definitions, suggesting mismatched braces or comment                        
                             delimiters and duplicate constructor signatures for `InputStream`.                                                                                 
                             - The patch includes an unterminated block comment (`/*  */`) and two identical `public PfbParser(InputStream in)` declarations,                  
                             leading to syntax conflicts.                                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                                
                             Areas for further investigation                                                                                                                    
                             1. **PfbParser.java syntax**                                                                                                                       
                                - Verify opening/closing of block comments and ensure no code is inadvertently commented out.                                                   
                                - Remove duplicate constructor signatures.                                                                                                      
                                - Confirm that `segment1` and `segment2` fields are declared and visible where assigned.                                                        
                                - Check method and class braces for proper nesting.                                                                                             
                             2. **toByteArrayLimited utility**                                                                                                                  
                                - Ensure `PfbParser.toByteArrayLimited(InputStream, int)` exists and is correctly declared.                                                     
                             3. **PDType1Font integration**                                                                                                                     
                                - Confirm imports and exception handling around the new limited-read approach.                                                                  
                                - Verify that repairing length logic still works with streamed data.                                                                            
                             4. **Build configuration**                                                                                                                         
                                - Make sure the FontBox module picks up the updated source and that no merge artifacts (unclosed comments, stray markers)                       
                             remain.                                                                                                                                            
                             5. **Test harness and fuzz targets**                                                                                                               
                                - While not the root cause, review the fuzzer entry point to confirm it passes streams correctly and respects new length                        
                             limits.                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                
                             This analysis highlights that the primary obstacle is syntax and structural errors introduced during the refactoring. Once the                     
                             Java source is syntactically correct, the new streaming logic can be validated against large PFB inputs to confirm it prevents                     
                             OOMs as intended.                                                                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                
                             ## Initial Issue Log                                                                                                                               
                             Here is the initial issue log of the codebase:                                                                                                     
                             <issue>

                             99:     * Create a new object.

                             101:     * @throws IOException if an IO-error occurs.

                             <code>                                                                                                                                             
                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java:63-72                                                                                  
                             ```                                                                                                                                                
                             63:    /**                                                                                                                                         
                             64:     * the EOF marker.                                                                                                                          
                             65:     */                                                                                                                                         
                             66:    private static final int EOF_MARKER = 0x03;                                                                                                 
                             67:                                                                                                                                                
                             68:    /**                                                                                                                                         
                             69:     * Heuristically chosen max length to buffer a Type1 font                                                                                   
                             70:     */                                                                                                                                         
                             71:    private static final long MAX_LENGTH = 100_000_000;                                                                                         
                             72:                                                                                                                                                
                             ```                                                                                                                                                
                             </code>                                                                                                                                            
                             <code>                                                                                                                                             
                             fontbox/src/main/java/org/apache/fontbox/pfb/PfbParser.java:124-164                                                                                
                             ```                                                                                                                                                
                             124:    private void parsePfb(final byte[] pfb) throws IOException                                                                                 
                             125:    {                                                                                                                                          
                             126:        if (pfb.length < PFB_HEADER_LENGTH)                                                                                                    
                             127:        {                                                                                                                                      
                             128:            throw new IOException("PFB header missing");                                                                                       
                             129:        }                                                                                                                                      
                             130:        // read into segments and keep them                                                                                                    
                             131:        List<Integer> typeList = new ArrayList<>(3);                                                                                           
                             132:        List<byte[]> barrList = new ArrayList<>(3);                                                                                            
                             133:        ByteArrayInputStream in = new ByteArrayInputStream(pfb);                                                                               
                             134:        int total = 0;                                                                                                                         
                             135:        do                                                                                                                                     
                             136:        {                                                                                                                                      
                             137:            int r = in.read();                                                                                                                 
                             138:            if (r == -1 && total > 0)                                                                                                          
                             139:            {                                                                                                                                  
                             140:                break; // EOF                                                                                                                  
                             141:            }                                                                                                                                  
                             142:            if (r != START_MARKER)                                                                                                             
                             143:            {                                                                                                                                  
                             144:                throw new IOException("Start marker missing");                                                                                 
                             145:            }                                                                                                                                  
                             146:            int recordType = in.read();                                                                                                        
                             147:            if (recordType == EOF_MARKER)                                                                                                      
                             148:            {                                                                                                                                  
                             149:                break;                                                                                                                         
                             150:            }                                                                                                                                  
                             151:            if (recordType != ASCII_MARKER && recordType != BINARY_MARKER)                                                                     
                             152:            {                                                                                                                                  
                             153:                throw new IOException("Incorrect record type: " + recordType);                                                                 
                             154:            }                                                                                                                                  
                             155:                                                                                                                                               
                             156:            int size = in.read();                                                                                                              
                             157:            size += in.read() << 8;                                                                                                            
                             158:            size += in.read() << 16;                                                                                                           
                             159:            size += in.read() << 24;                                                                                                           
                             160:            LOG.debug("record type: {}, segment size: {}", recordType, size);                                                                  
                             161:            long newTotal = total + size;                                                                                                      
                             162:            if (newTotal > MAX_LENGTH) {                                                                                                       
                             163:                throw new IOException("record size would be too large: " + newTotal);                                                          
                             164:            }                                                                                                                                  
                             ```                                                                                                                                                
                             </code>                                                                                                                                            
                             <code>                                                                                                                                             
                             pdfbox/src/main/java/org/apache/pdfbox/pdmodel/font/PDType1Font.java:216-224                                                                       
                             ```                                                                                                                                                
                             216:                    byte[] bytes = fontFile.toByteArray();                                                                                     
                             217:                    if (bytes.length == 0)                                                                                                     
                             218:                    {                                                                                                                          
                             219:                        throw new IOException("Font data unavailable");                                                                        
                             220:                    }                                                                                                                          
                             221:                    length1 = repairLength1(bytes, length1);                                                                                   
                             222:                    length2 = repairLength2(bytes, length1, length2);                                                                          
                             223:                                                                                                                                               
                             224:                    if ((bytes[0] & 0xff) == PFB_START_MARKER)                                                                                 
                             ```                                                                                                                                                
                             </code>
